intro: Afroligusticum aculeolatum, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange sap, which is toxic to humans and animals. The plant typically grows as a shrub with woody stems and small, alternate leaves. Its flowers are clustered in complex inflorescences called cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Afroligusticum aculeolatum is often found in rocky or sandy soils in arid and semi-arid regions.
